query: AI scientific discovery automated hypothesis generation knowledge graph LLM reasoning literature review research question generation bibliometric analysis semantic similarity scientific knowledge base

concepts.label: Knowledge Graph
concepts.description: A structured, semantic representation of entities and their relationships organized as a directed graph for information retrieval and reasoning.

concepts.label: Large Language Model
concepts.description: A deep learning model trained on large text corpora to understand and generate human language with semantic understanding.

concepts.label: AI Agent
concepts.description: An autonomous system capable of perceiving its environment and taking actions to achieve specified goals through intelligent decision-making.

concepts.label: Ontology
concepts.description: A formal representation of concepts, properties, and relationships within a domain that defines the structure and semantics of knowledge.

concepts.label: Product Description
concepts.description: Unstructured natural language text detailing the features, specifications, and characteristics of a commercial product.

concepts.label: Ontology Creation
concepts.description: The process of automatically generating domain-specific conceptual schemas and entity types from unstructured data.

concepts.label: Ontology Refinement
concepts.description: The iterative process of improving and validating ontology structure, consistency, and semantic correctness.

concepts.label: Knowledge Graph Population
concepts.description: The process of extracting entities and relationships from source data and instantiating them as nodes and edges in a knowledge graph.

concepts.label: Information Extraction
concepts.description: The task of automatically identifying and extracting structured information (entities, relations, attributes) from unstructured text.

concepts.label: Semantic Coherence
concepts.description: The property of maintaining consistent, non-contradictory meaning and logical relationships across extracted knowledge elements.

concepts.label: E-Commerce Platform
concepts.description: Digital marketplace infrastructure enabling the buying and selling of products with associated product data and metadata.

concepts.label: Recommendation System
concepts.description: An algorithmic system that suggests relevant products to users based on user preferences, item features, or collaborative patterns.

concepts.label: Property Coverage
concepts.description: A metric quantifying the percentage of entity properties and attributes successfully extracted from source data into the knowledge graph.

concepts.label: particle physics
concepts.description: Branch of physics studying the fundamental constituents of matter and their interactions.

concepts.label: science education
concepts.description: Systematic instruction and learning of scientific concepts and methods at school and institutional levels.

concepts.label: scientific outreach
concepts.description: Communication and engagement activities that present scientific research and discoveries to public and non-specialist audiences.

concepts.label: IPPOG
concepts.description: International Particle Physics Outreach Group, an organization promoting particle physics education and outreach globally since 1997.

concepts.label: Resource Database
concepts.description: Online platform providing curated collections of high-quality educational and outreach materials in particle physics and related sciences.

concepts.label: fundamental research
concepts.description: Scientific investigation aimed at understanding basic principles and laws of nature rather than immediate practical applications.

concepts.label: educational materials
concepts.description: Curated resources, tools, and content designed to facilitate learning and understanding of scientific concepts.

concepts.label: interdisciplinary research
concepts.description: Scientific research that integrates methods, theories, and concepts from multiple disciplines to address complex problems.

concepts.label: large language models
concepts.description: Deep learning models trained on vast corpora of text to extract, understand, and generate natural language concepts and relationships.

concepts.label: concept extraction
concepts.description: Automated process of identifying and isolating key concepts from large bodies of scientific literature using natural language processing or machine learning.

concepts.label: citation-reference relationships
concepts.description: Quantitative links between publications determined by direct citations and bibliographic references, measuring knowledge flow and influence.

concepts.label: numerical simulations
concepts.description: Computational methods for solving equations and modelling physical systems in astronomy to study celestial phenomena.

concepts.label: machine learning
concepts.description: Algorithmic approach enabling computers to learn patterns from data without explicit programming, applied to classification, prediction, and discovery tasks.

concepts.label: astronomical research
concepts.description: Scientific investigation of celestial objects, phenomena, and the structure of the universe using observational and computational methods.

concepts.label: technology integration
concepts.description: The process of incorporating new computational or methodological tools into existing scientific practice and infrastructure.

concepts.label: scientific breakthrough
concepts.description: Significant discovery or development that substantially advances understanding or capability in a scientific field.

concepts.label: temporal phase analysis
concepts.description: Method of dividing research evolution into distinct periods to identify transitions in technology adoption and scientific application.

concepts.label: AI-astronomy intersection
concepts.description: The convergence domain where machine learning and artificial intelligence methods combine with astronomical questions and datasets.

concepts.label: Relational database
concepts.description: A structured data storage system organized in tables with rows and columns following the relational model.

concepts.label: Semantic mapping
concepts.description: The process of aligning data elements from source systems to standardized semantic vocabularies and ontologies.

concepts.label: Multi-agent system
concepts.description: A computational system comprising multiple autonomous agents that collaborate to achieve shared objectives.

concepts.label: Schema.org
concepts.description: A standardized vocabulary of structured data types and properties widely used for semantic markup and data interoperability.

concepts.label: Data integration
concepts.description: The process of combining data from multiple heterogeneous sources into a unified, coherent representation.

concepts.label: Semantic agent
concepts.description: An autonomous LLM-based agent capable of understanding semantic relationships and performing intelligent mapping tasks.

concepts.label: Data interoperability
concepts.description: The ability of systems to exchange and use data seamlessly across different platforms and applications.

concepts.label: Table mapping
concepts.description: The process of linking database tables and columns to corresponding concepts in a target semantic framework.

concepts.label: Semantic layer
concepts.description: An abstraction layer positioned above raw data that provides standardized semantic interpretations and vocabulary mappings.

concepts.label: cognitive flow
concepts.description: An optimal cognitive state characterized by deep focus and intrinsic motivation when task difficulty aligns with individual skill level, extended to AI-augmented reasoning contexts.

concepts.label: flow theory
concepts.description: Psychological framework describing conditions under which individuals experience deep engagement and intrinsic motivation through balanced challenge and skill.

concepts.label: AI-augmented reasoning
concepts.description: Cognitive systems where artificial intelligence provides support and enhancement to human decision-making and complex reasoning processes.

concepts.label: cognitive interventions
concepts.description: AI-driven actions or prompts designed to support, guide, or augment human cognitive processes during reasoning and decision-making.

concepts.label: context-aware augmentation
concepts.description: Adaptive AI framework that personalizes cognitive support based on real-time contextual information about the user, task, and interaction state.

concepts.label: multimodal behavioral cues
concepts.description: Multiple simultaneous signals of user state derived from different modalities such as visual tracking, typing patterns, and interaction dynamics.

concepts.label: gaze behavior
concepts.description: Eye-tracking metric indicating visual attention patterns and cognitive load during task engagement.

concepts.label: typing hesitation
concepts.description: Temporal pattern in keyboard input reflecting moments of cognitive deliberation or uncertainty during reasoning.

concepts.label: interaction speed
concepts.description: Rate of user engagement with the system, measured through velocity of actions, responses, or interface manipulation.

concepts.label: skill-difficulty alignment
concepts.description: Correspondence between the cognitive demands of a task and the demonstrated competence of the individual performing it.

concepts.label: cognitive immersion
concepts.description: State of deep, uninterrupted engagement where the individual's attention is fully absorbed in the cognitive task.

concepts.label: intrinsic motivation
concepts.description: Internal drive to engage in an activity for its own sake rather than external rewards, central to flow experiences.

concepts.label: decision-making
concepts.description: Cognitive process of selecting among alternatives based on reasoning, evaluation, and judgment.

concepts.label: Clinical Knowledge
concepts.description: Insights and evidence gained from medical research regarding the causes, prognosis, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases, validated through real-world medical practice.

concepts.label: Knowledge Graphs
concepts.description: Structured representations of entities and their relationships in a domain, used to encode and organize clinical information for integration into models.

concepts.label: Retrieval-Augmented Generation
concepts.description: Technique that augments language model generation by retrieving relevant information from external sources to improve factual accuracy and traceability.

concepts.label: Medical LLMs
concepts.description: Large language models specifically trained or fine-tuned on medical data to perform clinical tasks such as diagnostic assistance and treatment recommendations.

concepts.label: Diagnostic Assistance
concepts.description: Application of AI models to support clinical decision-making by predicting or identifying diseases based on patient information.

concepts.label: Treatment Recommendations
concepts.description: AI-generated or AI-assisted suggestions for therapeutic interventions tailored to patient conditions.

concepts.label: Multimodal Data Integration
concepts.description: Process of combining multiple types of data (text, images, structured records) to enrich model training and improve clinical predictions.

concepts.label: Medical Datasets
concepts.description: Curated collections of medical data including clinical records, research literature, and annotated cases used for training and evaluation.

concepts.label: Medical Knowledge Sources
concepts.description: Reliable repositories of medical information such as databases, ontologies, and documented clinical guidelines used to support model development.

concepts.label: Decision Traceability
concepts.description: Property of a model enabling clear documentation of reasoning steps and evidence underlying predictions or recommendations.

concepts.label: Model Evaluation
concepts.description: Systematic assessment of model performance on clinical tasks using metrics and evaluation frameworks specific to medical applications.

concepts.label: Academic-Industry Gap
concepts.description: Disparity between medical LLMs developed in research institutions versus those deployed in industry settings regarding functionality and real-world applicability.

concepts.label: Literature review automation
concepts.description: Automated system for generating comprehensive literature reviews from research documents without manual effort.

concepts.label: Natural Language Processing
concepts.description: Field of computational linguistics focused on enabling computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language.

concepts.label: Frequency-based extraction
concepts.description: NLP method that identifies important terms by counting word occurrences and statistical prominence in documents.

concepts.label: Transformer model
concepts.description: Deep learning architecture using self-attention mechanisms; enables efficient parallel processing of sequential text data.

concepts.label: ROUGE evaluation metric
concepts.description: Automatic metric measuring n-gram overlap between generated and reference texts; commonly used for summarization assessment.

concepts.label: PDF document processing
concepts.description: Techniques for extracting, parsing, and converting unstructured text from PDF files into machine-readable format.

concepts.label: SciTLDR dataset
concepts.description: Scientific paper summarization benchmark dataset containing papers paired with TL;DR-style summaries for model training and evaluation.

concepts.label: Graphical user interface
concepts.description: Visual software application allowing end-users to interact with and operate the literature review system without technical expertise.

concepts.label: Text summarization
concepts.description: NLP task of condensing longer documents into shorter coherent texts while preserving key information.

concepts.label: Visual Question Answering
concepts.description: Task of answering natural language questions about images by jointly understanding visual and textual information.

concepts.label: Knowledge-Routed VQA
concepts.description: VQA variant that requires models to leverage external knowledge bases beyond image and question contexts to answer correctly.

concepts.label: Annotator bias
concepts.description: Systematic inconsistencies in dataset labels arising from subjective crowdsourcing annotations by different human annotators.

concepts.label: Shortcut learning
concepts.description: Phenomenon where deep models exploit superficial input-output correlations and spurious patterns instead of learning robust features.

concepts.label: Scene graph
concepts.description: Structured representation of an image encoding objects, attributes, and relationships as nodes and edges.

concepts.label: Multi-step reasoning
concepts.description: Inference process requiring sequential logical steps across multiple knowledge or scene graph triplets to reach an answer.

concepts.label: Deep representation embedding
concepts.description: Learned distributed vector representations encoding image, text, and knowledge features in a shared embedding space.

concepts.label: Image context perception
concepts.description: Model capability to correctly extract and understand visual content from images including objects and relationships.

concepts.label: Question understanding
concepts.description: Model capability to accurately parse and semantically comprehend natural language questions.

concepts.label: Answer ambiguity
concepts.description: Situation where multiple plausible answers exist for a question due to unclear question formulation or incomplete constraints.

concepts.label: Answer distribution balance
concepts.description: Dataset property ensuring answer labels are uniformly distributed across training and test sets to avoid bias toward frequent answers.

concepts.label: Controlled program generation
concepts.description: Systematic algorithmic procedure for synthesizing question-answer pairs deterministically from structured knowledge and scene graphs.

concepts.label: Knowledge utilization
concepts.description: The process by which models access and apply learned knowledge to solve problems or answer questions.

concepts.label: Hierarchical deconstruction
concepts.description: A method of breaking down complex problems into simpler sub-problems organized in a hierarchical structure.

concepts.label: DepthQA dataset
concepts.description: A curated dataset of questions deconstructed into three hierarchical levels of conceptual, procedural, and strategic knowledge.

concepts.label: Conceptual knowledge
concepts.description: Understanding of fundamental concepts and definitions required as a foundation for problem-solving.

concepts.label: Procedural knowledge
concepts.description: Knowledge of how to perform specific processes, steps, and techniques to solve problems.

concepts.label: Strategic knowledge
concepts.description: High-level understanding of when and how to apply procedures and concepts to solve complex problems.

concepts.label: Backward discrepancy
concepts.description: A performance gap where LLMs answer complex questions correctly but fail on constituent simpler sub-problems.

concepts.label: Model capacity
concepts.description: The size and representational power of a neural language model, typically measured by parameter count.

concepts.label: Training data memorization
concepts.description: The phenomenon where models reproduce learned training examples rather than generalizing underlying patterns.

concepts.label: Multi-turn interactions
concepts.description: Sequential question-answering exchanges where models are guided progressively from simpler to more complex problems.

concepts.label: Problem-solving ability
concepts.description: The capacity of models to reason through and correctly answer complex, multi-step questions.

concepts.label: Factual knowledge
concepts.description: Verifiable, explicit information about entities, relationships, and properties grounded in structured representations.

concepts.label: Black-box models
concepts.description: Machine learning models whose internal reasoning processes and decision-making mechanisms are not transparent or interpretable to users.

concepts.label: KG-enhanced LLMs
concepts.description: Framework incorporating knowledge graphs during pre-training and inference phases of language models to improve factual grounding and interpretability.

concepts.label: LLM-augmented KGs
concepts.description: Framework leveraging language models to improve knowledge graph tasks including embedding, completion, construction, and question answering.

concepts.label: Synergized LLMs and KGs
concepts.description: Framework where language models and knowledge graphs play equal roles with bidirectional reasoning driven by both data and knowledge.

concepts.label: Knowledge graph completion
concepts.description: Task of predicting missing facts or relationships in incomplete knowledge graphs to populate unseen knowledge.

concepts.label: Knowledge graph construction
concepts.description: Process of automatically extracting entities and relationships from text to build or expand structured knowledge representations.

concepts.label: Graph-to-text generation
concepts.description: Task of generating natural language descriptions from structured graph representations of knowledge.

concepts.label: Question answering
concepts.description: Task of retrieving or generating answers to natural language questions using knowledge sources.

concepts.label: Knowledge graph embeddings
concepts.description: Learned low-dimensional vector representations of entities and relations in knowledge graphs that preserve structural and semantic information.

concepts.label: Bidirectional reasoning
concepts.description: Reasoning process that simultaneously integrates symbolic reasoning from knowledge graphs with neural reasoning from language models.

concepts.label: Entity extraction
concepts.description: Automated identification and classification of named entities (persons, organizations, concepts) from text.

concepts.label: Relationship extraction
concepts.description: Automated identification and classification of semantic relationships between entities in text.

concepts.label: Text Mining
concepts.description: Process of deriving structured information and patterns from unstructured text documents.

concepts.label: Scientific knowledge graph
concepts.description: Domain-specific knowledge graph representing scholarly entities and relationships including publications, authors, venues, and research topics.

concepts.label: Research publication metadata
concepts.description: Structured information about scholarly papers including authors, venues, organizations, dates, and citations.

concepts.label: Semantic annotation
concepts.description: Process of adding machine-readable semantic meaning and labels to unstructured content.

concepts.label: Hybrid system
concepts.description: Integrated approach combining multiple NLP and Machine Learning tools and techniques for knowledge extraction.

concepts.label: Scholarly domain
concepts.description: Academic and research sector encompassing scientific publications, researchers, institutions, and knowledge.

concepts.label: corpus distillation
concepts.description: Process of extracting and refining high-quality, representative textual data from large scientific literature to create compact training datasets.

concepts.label: MeSH hierarchy
concepts.description: Medical Subject Headings controlled vocabulary and thesaurus organized in a hierarchical structure used for indexing biomedical literature.

concepts.label: knowledge-driven framework
concepts.description: System design approach that leverages structured domain knowledge and ontologies to guide information extraction and processing.

concepts.label: biomedical ontologies
concepts.description: Formal representations of biomedical domain concepts and their relationships, providing structured knowledge organization.

concepts.label: question-answer pairs
concepts.description: Training data format consisting of domain-specific questions paired with corresponding answers, used for supervised learning.

concepts.label: biomedical question-answering
concepts.description: Task of automatically answering natural language questions about biomedical topics using trained language models.

concepts.label: self-evaluation mechanism
concepts.description: Automated process by which agents assess and refine the quality of extracted data without external supervision.

concepts.label: domain coverage
concepts.description: Extent to which a dataset comprehensively represents the breadth of topics and concepts within a scientific domain.

concepts.label: LLM training data
concepts.description: Curated corpus of text used to pretrain or fine-tune large language models.

concepts.label: model fine-tuning
concepts.description: Process of adapting a pretrained language model to specialized tasks or domains through continued training on domain-specific data.

concepts.label: Relation embeddings
concepts.description: Distributed vector representations of relations in a knowledge graph, encoding semantic meaning of relation types.

concepts.label: Attention mechanisms
concepts.description: Neural mechanisms that weight different parts of input data, allowing models to focus on relevant information dynamically.

concepts.label: Message passing
concepts.description: Graph neural network technique where node representations are updated by aggregating information from neighboring nodes.

concepts.label: Local neighbors
concepts.description: Immediate neighboring entities and relations directly connected to a given entity in the knowledge graph.

concepts.label: Long-term dependencies
concepts.description: Semantic relationships and information that span multiple hops or distances in the knowledge graph structure.

concepts.label: Semantic context
concepts.description: Contextual information derived from the semantic meaning and relationships encoded in paths between entities.

concepts.label: Paths
concepts.description: Sequences of entities and relations connecting two entities in a knowledge graph.

concepts.label: Contextualized representations
concepts.description: Entity and relation embeddings that incorporate contextual information from their position and neighborhood in the knowledge graph.

concepts.label: MP model
concepts.description: Proposed attention-based model learning embeddings from multiple patterns for knowledge graph relation prediction.

concepts.label: knowledge emergence
concepts.description: The process by which new scientific understanding arises from discoveries and becomes integrated into existing scientific frameworks and communication structures.

concepts.label: scientific communication
concepts.description: The systems, practices, and networks through which scientists disseminate, share, and establish credibility of research findings within the research community.

concepts.label: network analysis
concepts.description: Quantitative methodology for mapping and analyzing relationships and connections within structured systems, including citation networks and institutional relationships.

concepts.label: fullerenes
concepts.description: Spherical or ellipsoidal allotropes of carbon discovered in 1985, containing only carbon atoms arranged in closed hollow structures.

concepts.label: nanotubes
concepts.description: Cylindrical nanostructures composed of rolled graphene sheets, synthesized from carbon and representing an extension of fullerene research.

concepts.label: journal structure
concepts.description: The organizational, institutional, and editorial framework of peer-reviewed scientific journals that govern knowledge dissemination.

concepts.label: semantic codification
concepts.description: The process by which concepts and phenomena acquire standardized terminology and definitions within scientific discourse.

concepts.label: cognitive foundation
concepts.description: The accumulated conceptual understanding and theoretical frameworks that serve as the basis for subsequent research and discoveries.

concepts.label: institutional change
concepts.description: Structural transformations in scientific institutions, particularly journals and research organizations, in response to new knowledge domains.

concepts.label: hypothesis-driven research
concepts.description: Scientific methodology where predictions and explanations are formulated as testable hypotheses before experimental validation.

concepts.label: graph neural network
concepts.description: Deep learning architecture operating on graph-structured data to learn node and edge representations for prediction tasks.

concepts.label: hallucination
concepts.description: Phenomenon where language models generate plausible but factually incorrect or unsupported outputs.

concepts.label: dimensionality reduction
concepts.description: Technique to project high-dimensional data into lower-dimensional space for visualization and interpretability.

concepts.label: hypothesis chain
concepts.description: Iteratively refined sequence of linked hypotheses connecting predictions through knowledge graph relationships and semantic linkages.

concepts.label: validation prioritization
concepts.description: Process of ranking and filtering hypotheses based on evidence strength to identify promising candidates for experimental testing.

concepts.label: visual analytics
concepts.description: Interactive visualization techniques combined with algorithmic analysis to support exploratory data analysis and decision-making.

concepts.label: human-AI collaboration
concepts.description: Interactive system design integrating human expertise and judgment with artificial intelligence models for enhanced reasoning and decision support.

concepts.label: biomedical knowledge
concepts.description: Structured and unstructured information about biological systems, diseases, drugs, and molecular mechanisms relevant to medicine.

concepts.label: Knowledge Base Question Answering
concepts.description: Task of answering natural language questions by querying structured knowledge bases to retrieve relevant entities and relations.

concepts.label: Few-shot Learning
concepts.description: Machine learning paradigm where models are trained with only a small number of annotated examples to adapt to new tasks.

concepts.label: SPARQL Queries
concepts.description: Query language for retrieving and manipulating data stored in RDF knowledge bases using structured graph patterns.

concepts.label: Program Synthesis
concepts.description: Automated process of generating executable programs (e.g., SPARQL queries) from high-level specifications or natural language descriptions.

concepts.label: Synthetic Data Generation
concepts.description: Process of artificially creating training data through algorithmic means rather than manual annotation.

concepts.label: Self-training
concepts.description: Semi-supervised learning technique where a model iteratively improves by making predictions on unlabeled data and using high-confidence predictions as training signals.

concepts.label: Distribution Shift
concepts.description: Discrepancy between the distribution of training data and test data, causing model performance degradation in real-world deployment.

concepts.label: Lightweight Models
concepts.description: Compact neural models designed for efficient inference with reduced parameters and computational requirements.

concepts.label: Entity Disambiguation
concepts.description: Process of identifying and linking entity mentions in natural language to their corresponding entries in a knowledge base.

concepts.label: Zero-shot Learning
concepts.description: Machine learning paradigm where models perform on tasks without any task-specific training examples.

concepts.label: Automated driving
concepts.description: Research domain focused on developing systems capable of operating vehicles with minimal human intervention using advanced computational methods.

concepts.label: Perception
concepts.description: Task in automated driving involving sensor data processing and interpretation to detect and classify objects in the environment.

concepts.label: Scene understanding
concepts.description: Process of interpreting the driving environment by identifying relevant objects, their relationships, and contextual information from sensor data.

concepts.label: Motion planning
concepts.description: Computational process of determining safe and feasible trajectories for vehicle movement considering constraints and objectives.

concepts.label: Validation
concepts.description: Process of verifying and ensuring that automated driving systems meet safety, reliability, and functional requirements.

concepts.label: Reliability
concepts.description: System property ensuring consistent performance and dependability of automated driving systems under specified conditions.

concepts.label: Safety
concepts.description: Critical requirement in automated driving ensuring systems operate without causing harm to passengers, pedestrians, or property.

concepts.label: Graph-structured data
concepts.description: Data organized as networks of interconnected nodes and edges with complex relationships and inter-dependencies.

concepts.label: Knowledge graph reasoning
concepts.description: The process of inferring new facts or relationships from existing knowledge graphs using logical or computational methods.

concepts.label: Symbolic logic
concepts.description: Formal reasoning approach based on logical rules and symbolic representation, producing deterministic and explainable results.

concepts.label: Logic-embedding integration
concepts.description: Combined approach that merges symbolic logic with embedding methods to leverage determinism and explainability alongside efficiency and uncertainty handling.

concepts.label: Uncertainty
concepts.description: Lack of determinism in knowledge representation and reasoning, necessitating probabilistic or soft inference approaches.

concepts.label: Vector computation
concepts.description: Efficient numerical computation using continuous-valued vectors, enabling scalable embedding-based reasoning.

concepts.label: Plausible knowledge prediction
concepts.description: Inference of likely but not necessarily certain new facts or relationships in incomplete knowledge graphs.

concepts.label: scientific research
concepts.description: A systematic process applying methods of scientific inquiry to solve consequential problems, satisfy human wants, exploit opportunities, or cope with environmental threats.

concepts.label: science
concepts.description: The discovery of root causes of phenomena to explain and predict them in a context of adaptation of life to new economic and social bases.

concepts.label: socioeconomic driving forces
concepts.description: Social and economic interests, concerns, and incentives that motivate nations to produce scientific research.

concepts.label: national interest
concepts.description: Organized social efforts reflecting the concerns and interests of nations to achieve scientific advances and discoveries.

concepts.label: wealth creation
concepts.description: Economic value and prosperity generated through scientific advances and technological superiority.

concepts.label: technological superiority
concepts.description: Competitive advantage gained by nations through development and application of advanced technologies derived from scientific research.

concepts.label: power
concepts.description: Social and geopolitical dominance achieved by nations through scientific and technological advancement.

concepts.label: R&D investment
concepts.description: Financial resources allocated by nations toward research and development activities.

concepts.label: productivity
concepts.description: Economic output and efficiency gains resulting from research and development activities.

concepts.label: environmental threats
concepts.description: Ecological and existential challenges such as resource scarcity or climate change that motivate scientific research.

concepts.label: research policy
concepts.description: Government strategies and institutional frameworks that guide allocation of resources and direction of scientific research.

concepts.label: social effort
concepts.description: Coordinated organizational and institutional action by societies to support and advance scientific research.

concepts.label: Educational recommendation system
concepts.description: A system that predicts and recommends learning resources to students based on their knowledge state and engagement patterns.

concepts.label: Learner model
concepts.description: A probabilistic representation of a learner's knowledge state, skills, and predicted engagement with learning materials.

concepts.label: Semantic relatedness
concepts.description: The degree to which two knowledge topics or components are conceptually related or connected through shared meaning.

concepts.label: Knowledge components
concepts.description: Atomic or granular units of knowledge that compose larger learning domains and can be represented hierarchically.

concepts.label: Learner engagement
concepts.description: The degree to which a learner interacts with and participates in learning resources, often measured as a target variable in educational systems.

concepts.label: Latent knowledge
concepts.description: Unobserved or hidden knowledge possessed by a learner that is inferred from observed interactions and behaviour.

concepts.label: Wikipedia link graph
concepts.description: The network structure of hyperlinks connecting Wikipedia articles, used as a resource to capture semantic relationships between concepts.

concepts.label: Bayesian machine learning
concepts.description: A probabilistic approach to learning that uses Bayesian inference to model uncertainty and update beliefs about model parameters.

concepts.label: Lifelong learning
concepts.description: An educational scenario in which learners continuously acquire knowledge and skills over extended time periods.

concepts.label: TrueLearn algorithm
concepts.description: An existing educational engagement prediction algorithm that models learner knowledge state using Bayesian methods.

concepts.label: Semantic TrueLearn
concepts.description: An extended version of the TrueLearn algorithm that incorporates semantic knowledge graph structure to improve learner engagement prediction.

concepts.label: Predictive performance
concepts.description: The accuracy or effectiveness of a model in predicting outcomes such as learner engagement or knowledge.

edges.evidence: AI agent-driven framework for constructing product knowledge graphs directly from unstructured product descriptions
Leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs), our method operates in three stages using dedicated agents
constructing product knowledge graphs directly from unstructured product descriptions
ontology creation and expansion, ontology refinement, and knowledge graph population
method operates in three stages using dedicated agents: ontology creation and expansion, ontology refinement
ontology refinement, and knowledge graph population; ontology defines the structure for population
knowledge graph population as final stage produces the instantiated knowledge graph
extracting entities and relationships from source data is core to KG population; framework extracts structured information
agent-based approach ensures semantic coherence, scalability, and high-quality output
creating significant challenges for information retrieval, recommendation systems, and data analytics; KGs provide structured format
automated product knowledge graph construction in E-Commerce; framework evaluates on product dataset
The framework achieves over 97% property coverage and minimal redundancy, validating its effectiveness
method operates in three stages using dedicated agents: ontology creation and expansion
LLMs leverage semantic understanding to automate structured knowledge extraction
IPPOG has been making concerted efforts to present and popularise particle physics across all audiences and age groups since 1997.
IPPOG serves as a strategic pillar in fostering long-term sustainable support for fundamental research, functioning as an outreach organization.
IPPOG has been offering tools to the scientific community, teachers and educators for almost 10 years.
The RDB is an online platform containing a collection of high quality engaging education and outreach materials.
One of the main tools IPPOG has been offering is the Resource Database, an online platform for education and outreach materials.
The RDB contains materials in particle physics and related sciences.
Outreach activities bridge the gap between school education and modern scientific research.
Particle physics is a fundamental research discipline studying basic constituents of matter.
LLMs provide a new tool to extract key concepts from vast literature beyond keyword searches, enabling quantification of integration of new ideas.
Extracted 24,939 concepts were then used to form a knowledge graph, where link strength between concepts was determined by citation-reference relationships.
Link strength between any two concepts in the knowledge graph was determined by their relevance through citation-reference relationships.
The knowledge graph demonstrates the impact of numerical simulations on astronomical research by quantifying relevance across different time periods.
The knowledge graph quantified the impact of machine learning on astronomical research by calculating relevance across different time periods.
Numerical simulations represent one of the new technologies quantified as driving further scientific breakthroughs in astronomical research.
Machine learning is quantified as a technology that has made inroads in astronomy and drives scientific discovery, though with identified bottlenecks.
Technological advancements drive further scientific breakthroughs; the study quantifies how new technologies drive discovery in astronomy.
The knowledge graph demonstrates two phases of development: integration phase and exploration phase, revealing how technology adoption unfolds temporally.
AI-astronomy intersection describes the convergence of machine learning methods with astronomical research domains.
There is currently a lack of new concept development at the intersection of AI and Astronomy, which may be a bottleneck preventing machine learning from further transforming astronomy.
Identifying factors contributing to interdisciplinary research success is crucial for advancing scientific discovery; the study quantifies how technological integration drives breakthroughs.
The knowledge graph quantifies the integration of new ideas and technological advancements in astronomical research across an interdisciplinary domain.
The work presents an approach for integrating multiple databases using knowledge graphs, focusing on mapping and connecting structured data.
The methodology introduces a system comprising multiple LLM agents that map tables and columns to Schema.org terms.
Semantic agents are implemented as large language models leveraging existing vocabularies for mapping tasks.
LLM agents map tables and columns to Schema.org terms as part of the proposed approach.
The system maps tables and columns to Schema.org terms, utilizing existing vocabularies for semantic alignment.
The methodology introduces a semantic layer above tables in relational databases to enable structured data integration.
Integrating disparate data sources through knowledge graphs enables businesses to unlock the full potential of their data.
A key to overcoming interoperability challenges lies in integrating disparate data sources across siloed systems.
Mapping and connecting structured data across systems by leveraging existing vocabularies addresses data interoperability challenges.
The semantic layer above database tables facilitates the mapping process to standardized vocabularies.
The system comprises multiple LLM agents working together to map tables and columns.
Paper describes cognitive flow as 'an extension of flow theory in AI-augmented reasoning'
Flow theory describes optimal cognitive state 'where a task's difficulty aligns with their skill level'
Cognitive flow involves 'deep focus and intrinsic motivation'
Interventions that disrupt the state of cognitive flow 'can hinder rather than enhance decision-making'
Framework 'adapts interventions based on three key contextual factors: type, timing, and scale'
AI can 'leverage multimodal behavioral cues (e.g., gaze behavior, typing hesitation, interaction speed)' to dynamically adjust support
Gaze behavior listed as example multimodal behavioral cue

Interaction speed listed as example multimodal behavioral cue

Medical LLMs are large language models specifically trained or fine-tuned on medical data.
The paper reviews initiatives to embed clinical knowledge into LLMs to ensure accurate medical knowledge in models.
Knowledge graphs are technologies used to integrate clinical knowledge into KG-supported LLMs.
RAG is a technology for integrating external knowledge sources into RAG-assisted LLMs.
Specialized datasets are used for training-based integration of clinical knowledge into LLMs.
Text and multimodal data integration are approaches for incorporating clinical knowledge into models.
Reliable knowledge sources from the medical domain, including databases and datasets, are gathered for model development.
Medical LLMs are developed for applications such as diagnostic assistance and treatment recommendations.
Medical LLMs are developed for applications such as diagnostic assistance and treatment recommendations.
Models must deliver traceable decision-making processes, a key requirement for clinical LLMs.
Knowledge graphs provide structured representations that improve traceability of model reasoning.
RAG improves decision traceability by retrieving and documenting evidence supporting generated recommendations.
Evaluation systems are discussed as applicable to relevant tasks for assessing medical LLM performance.
The paper assesses the disparity between models developed in academic settings and those in industry.
The research evaluates several Natural Language Processing strategies as the core methods to automate literature review generation.
Developing a system capable of automatically generating literature reviews from only PDF files as input is the primary objective.
RAG is implemented with Large Language Model (GPT-3.5-turbo) as one of three evaluated systems.
GPT-3.5-turbo is used to generate literature reviews, which requires text summarization capabilities.
Simple T5 transformer model is utilized as one of three distinct techniques to implement auto-generating systems.
spaCy frequency-based method is evaluated as one of the NLP strategies for auto-generating literature reviews.
ROUGE scores are used for the evaluation of all three systems.
The SciTLDR dataset is chosen for this research experiment to train and evaluate the three different systems.
The Large Language Model GPT-3.5-turbo achieved the highest ROUGE-1 score, 0.364, outperforming other approaches.
A graphical user interface is created for the best system based on the large language model.
RAG with LLM is one of three evaluated techniques for generating literature reviews through improved context-grounded summarization.
Knowledge-Routed VQA is a variant of VQA that incorporates knowledge reasoning as a core requirement.
Crowdsourced annotations with annotator bias often lead to superficial over-fitted correlations that models exploit as shortcuts.
Deep embedding models exploit shortcut correlations rather than learning robust representations; the proposed dataset aims to cutoff this behavior.
Programs generate question-answer pairs deterministically from structured data instead of crowdsourcing, eliminating annotator subjectivity.
Programs are designed to avoid answer ambiguity through structured constraints and selection logic.
Programs balance answer distribution across the dataset as part of their design constraints.
Scene graphs from Visual Genome are used as a data source for generating Knowledge-Routed VQA question-answer pairs.
External knowledge bases provide triplets from which controlled programs generate knowledge-routed questions.
Programs push multi-step reasoning by selecting one or two triplets requiring sequential inference.
A desirable VQA model must correctly perceive image context; the dataset enforces this by ensuring only one knowledge triplet relates to image objects.
A desirable VQA model must understand the question; this is a core requirement of knowledge reasoning.
Models must incorporate learned knowledge from external bases into their embedding representations.
The dataset design aims to cutoff shortcut learning by enforcing that only one knowledge relates to image objects and all questions use different knowledge.
The DepthQA dataset is created by deconstructing questions into a hierarchical graph representing different depths of knowledge.
DepthQA deconstructs questions into three depths: (i) recalling conceptual knowledge as the first level.
DepthQA deconstructs questions into (ii) applying procedural knowledge as the second level.
DepthQA deconstructs questions into (iii) analyzing strategic knowledge as the third level.
The paper studies how LLMs use their knowledge for reasoning, examining their knowledge utilization patterns.
Based on a hierarchical graph, we quantify forward discrepancy, a discrepancy in LLM performance on simpler sub-problems versus complex questions.
Smaller models exhibit more discrepancies than larger models, showing an inverse relationship with model capacity.
Distinct patterns of discrepancies are observed across model capacity and possibility of training data memorization.
Guiding models from simpler to complex questions through multi-turn interactions improves performance across model sizes.
Structured intermediate steps in knowledge reasoning, enabled by hierarchical deconstruction, improve problem-solving abilities.
Understanding how LLMs utilize knowledge enhances problem-solving abilities through structured reasoning.
LLMs are black-box models, which often fall short of capturing and accessing factual knowledge.
Knowledge Graphs are structured knowledge models that explicitly store rich factual knowledge.
KG-enhanced LLMs incorporate KGs during the pre-training and inference phases of LLMs, or for the purpose of enhancing understanding of the knowledge learned by LLMs.
KGs can enhance LLMs by providing external knowledge for inference and interpretability.
LLM-augmented KGs leverage LLMs for different KG tasks such as embedding, completion, construction, graph-to-text generation, and question answering.
LLM-augmented KGs leverage LLMs for different KG tasks.
Knowledge graph completion is one of the KG tasks that leverage LLMs.
Knowledge graph construction is one of the KG tasks that leverage LLMs.
Graph-to-text generation is one of the KG tasks that leverage LLMs.
Question answering is one of the KG tasks that leverage LLMs.
Knowledge embedding is one of the KG tasks that leverage LLMs.
Synergized LLMs and KGs play equal roles and work in a mutually beneficial way to enhance both LLMs and KGs.
Synergized LLMs and KGs play equal roles and work in a mutually beneficial way to enhance both LLMs and KGs.
Synergized LLMs and KGs enable bidirectional reasoning driven by both data and knowledge.
LLMs often fall short of capturing and accessing factual knowledge.

Machine Learning techniques applied for extracting relationships from research publications

Scientific knowledge graphs focus on scholarly domain representing research entities and relationships
Corpus distillation addresses insufficient quantity and quality in open-source annotated scientific corpora, a bottleneck for effective LLM training in biomedical research.
The collaborative multi-agent architecture works to autonomously extract, synthesize, and self-evaluate high-quality textual data from vast scientific literature.
Specialized agents are each guided by the Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) hierarchy to work in concert.
A knowledge-driven, agentic framework for scientific corpus distillation tailored for LLM training in biomedical domain.
Question-answer pairs are generated ensuring consistency with biomedical ontologies.
Agents autonomously extract high-quality textual data from vast scientific literature through mining processes.
Language models trained on multi-agent distilled datasets achieve notable improvements in biomedical question-answering tasks.
The agentic framework collectively generates and refines domain-specific question-answer pairs through self-evaluation.
Language models trained on distilled datasets are evaluated on biomedical question-answering tasks.
The framework ensures comprehensive coverage of the biomedical domain while maintaining consistency.
The multi-agent distilled datasets serve as training data for biomedical LLM development.
Corpus distillation generates AI-Ready datasets that enable improved LLM training.
Knowledge bases are naturally incomplete; relation prediction is proposed as a solution to complete their information.
Recent works tackle this challenge by learning embeddings for entities and relations, then employing them to predict new relations.
Learning embeddings for entities and relations enables prediction of new relations among entities.
MP acquires entities' context information through an attention-enhanced message-passing scheme.
An attention-enhanced message-passing scheme captures entities' local semantics while focusing on different aspects of their neighborhood.
Most methods focus only on the local neighbors of a relation to learn the embeddings.
Methods may fail to capture KGs' context information by neglecting long-term dependencies and the propagation of entities' semantics.
Semantic context is captured by leveraging the paths and their relationships between entities.
Capturing semantic context, by leveraging paths and their relationships between entities, improves representation of entities.
Empirical findings show how attention mechanisms can improve entities' context representation.
Combining entities and semantic path contexts improves the general representation of entities and the relation predictions.
MP is a novel model for learning contextualized representations of entities through attention-enhanced message-passing.
MP outperforms or competes with state-of-the-art relation prediction methods on several knowledge graph benchmarks.
The discovery of fullerenes in 1985 is analyzed as the scientific discovery that triggered a process which led to research in nanotubes.
Knowledge emergence has effects on the structure of scientific communication as new knowledge becomes integrated and disseminated.
Network analysis is applied to understand this emergence institutionally as changes in the journals; semantically, as changes in the codification of meaning.
Knowledge emergence is analyzed institutionally as changes in the journals.
Knowledge emergence is analyzed semantically as changes in the codification of meaning in terms of words.
The discovery of fullerenes in 1985 triggered a process which led to research in nanotubes.
The discovery of fullerenes in 1985 is analyzed as the scientific discovery that triggered subsequent research.
The new knowledge becomes the emergent foundation of further developments.
Institutional changes in journals constitute fundamental changes in scientific communication structure.
The standardization of terminology and meaning (semantic codification) enables the formation of stable cognitive foundations for further research.
LLMs 'suffer from hallucinations and lack grounding in structured knowledge, limiting their reliability'
RAGs augment LLMs with retrieved knowledge to reduce hallucinations and improve factual grounding
RAGs leverage structured knowledge from KGs to ground LLM reasoning
HypoChainer 'integrates human expertise, LLM-driven reasoning, and knowledge graphs to enhance hypothesis generation and validation'
Experts use 'dimensionality reduction to navigate large-scale GNN predictions'
Experts 'iteratively examine KG relationships around predictions and semantically linked entities, refining hypotheses'
Stage two produces hypothesis chains; stage three filters 'refined hypotheses based on KG-supported evidence'
Hypotheses are 'filtered based on KG-supported evidence to identify high-priority candidates for experimentation'
Visual analytics 'further strengthen weak links in reasoning' during hypothesis refinement
Modern scientific discovery requires 'integrating vast and heterogeneous knowledge critical to breakthroughs in biomedicine'
HypoChainer demonstrates 'its potential to support interpretable, scalable, and knowledge-grounded scientific discovery'
FlexKBQA leverages LLMs as program translators for converting SPARQL queries into natural language questions.
Automated algorithms sample diverse programs, such as SPARQL queries, from the knowledge base.
The synthetic dataset facilitates training a specialized lightweight model with minimal annotation burden.
Execution-guided self-training reduces the distribution shift between synthetic data and real user questions.
FlexKBQA trains a specialized lightweight model for the knowledge base to enable efficient deployment.
The framework harnesses the inherent reasoning capability of LLMs to enhance the entire KBQA system.
FlexKBQA tackles few-shot KBQA where high-quality annotated data is insufficient in real-world scenarios.
SPARQL queries are sampled from the knowledge base and converted into natural language questions for synthetic data creation.
Entity linking is a critical component of KBQA systems for handling diverse entities within knowledge bases.
FlexKBQA achieves impressive results in both few-shot and the more challenging zero-shot scenarios.
Programs such as SPARQL queries are sampled from the knowledge base for structured data retrieval.
Execution-guided self-training iteratively leverages unlabeled user questions to improve the lightweight model.
KGs have recently gained significant attention from both industry and academia for applications that benefit automated driving tasks.
Recent progress in knowledge graph embeddings and graph neural networks allows applying machine learning to graph-structured data.
Recent progress in knowledge graph embeddings allows applying machine learning to graph-structured data.
Deep learning methods have made remarkable breakthroughs in automated driving.
Ontologies are listed as the first main task of AD where KGs are applied.
Perception is one of the main tasks of AD for incorporating available information and knowledge.
Scene understanding is one of the main tasks of AD listed in the survey.
Motion planning is one of the main tasks of AD where KGs are applied.
Validation is one of the main tasks of AD addressed by KG-based approaches.
Ontologies form the structural foundation for knowledge representation in KGs.
KGs are applied to perception tasks in automated driving to effectively incorporate available information.
KGs help exploit structured and relational data for scene understanding in AD.
KGs are applied to motion planning tasks by providing structured knowledge of driving scenarios.
KGs are applied to validation tasks for ensuring reliability and safety of automated systems.
Reliability is a critical unsolved problem to guarantee in automated driving systems.
Safety is an essential unsolved problem, especially to effectively incorporate knowledge in the driving task.
Knowledge graphs exploit structured, dynamic, and relational data organized as graph-structured data.
Graph neural networks are designed to handle the complexity of graph-structured data with complex relationships and inter-dependencies.
Conventional KG reasoning based on symbolic logic is deterministic, with reasoning results being explainable.
Modern embedding-based reasoning can deal with uncertainty and predict plausible knowledge, often with high efficiency via vector computation.
Conventional KG reasoning based on symbolic logic is deterministic, with reasoning results being explainable.
Conventional KG reasoning based on symbolic logic is deterministic, contrasting with embedding-based methods that can deal with uncertainty.
Modern embedding-based reasoning can deal with uncertainty and predict plausible knowledge.

Modern embedding-based reasoning often achieves high efficiency via vector computation.
A promising direction is to integrate both logic-based and embedding-based methods.
A promising direction is to integrate both logic-based and embedding-based methods.
Integrated approach aims to have advantages of both logic-based (explainability) and embedding-based (efficiency) methods.
A promising direction is to integrate both logic-based and embedding-based methods for KG reasoning.

A semantic knowledge graph encodes semantic relatedness between knowledge topics by representing their structural relationships.
Semantic TrueLearn is described as a novel semantic version of TrueLearn that adds semantic awareness to the base model.
The semantic knowledge graph is leveraged to build a humanly intuitive knowledge representation within the learner model.
The system propagates latent information across semantically related topics to improve knowledge state inference.
The learner model is used to better predict learner engagement in the educational recommendation system.
The Wikipedia link graph is used as a resource to exploit semantic relatedness between knowledge components.
Semantic TrueLearn achieves statistically significant improvements in predicting learner engagement.
Semantic TrueLearn leverages Bayesian machine learning to improve the predictive performance of educational engagement.
Semantic relatedness is defined between knowledge components in learning resources.
The educational recommendation system incorporates a novel learner model to predict learner engagement.
The state-aware educational recommendation system is designed for lifelong learning scenarios.
Semantic TrueLearn achieves statistically significant improvements in terms of predictive performance.
